cw3

Class Building

  • java.lang.Object
    • cw3.Building

  • public class Building
extends java.lang.Object
    This class denotes an American-style building (no 13th floor) with an elevator and randomly chosen customers.

    It is used by the AppDriver class to simulate elevator operation.

    Since:
    10th November 2014
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Liran Harary & Shay Meshulam

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The building's bottom floor
      private java.util.ArrayList<Customer> customerList

      private Elevator elevator
      The building's elevator
      private int numFloors
      Number of floors in the building

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Building(int numFloors, int numCustomers, int bottomFloor)
      Takes as arguments: number of floors, number of customers and bottom floor. Sets this building's numFloors and bottomFloor. Populates customerList with random customers according to the number of customers. Set the elevator to a new elevator with the arguments: numFloors, bottomFloor and customerList.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Building

        public Building(int numFloors,
                int numCustomers,
                int bottomFloor)
        • Takes as arguments: number of floors, number of customers and bottom floor.
        • Sets this building's numFloors and bottomFloor.
        • Populates customerList with random customers according to the number of customers.
        • Set the elevator to a new elevator with the arguments: numFloors, bottomFloor and customerList.
        Parameters:
        numFloors - Number of floors in this building
        numCustomers - Number of customers wishing to use the elevator
        bottomFloor - The level of the bottom floor of this building

    • Method Detail

      • populateCustomerList

        public void populateCustomerList(int numCustomers)
        Takes the number of customers as an argument and populates customerList with Customer objects with random currentFloor and destinationFloor.

        Ensures that:

        • the Customers don't have the same value for currentFloor and destinationFloor.
        • the currentFloor and destinationFloor is not 13 for any given Customer. If a randomly selected number happens to be 13, it is changed to 14.
        Parameters:
        numCustomers - number of random customers to create in customerList

      • getNumFloors

        public int getNumFloors()
        Returns the number of floors in this building
        Returns:
        numFloors

      • setNumFloors

        private void setNumFloors(int numFloors)
        Sets this building's numFloors

        Prints error message if numFloors is smaller than 2

        Parameters:
        numFloors - Number of floors in this building
